"We acknowledge our error in not stating that data from TraceTogether is not exempt from the Criminal Procedure Code. I take full responsibility for this mistake."

In a Parliament session on Feb. 2, Minister Vivian Balakrishnan addressed privacy concerns over the TraceTogether programme, adding that he "regret[s] the consternation [and] the anxiety" caused.

He further emphasised that TraceTogether and other digital contact tracing programmes would be deactivated when Covid-19 is over.

Responding to a parliamentary question on Feb. 1, Minister for Education Lawrence Wong warned that issues of gender identity have become "bitterly contested sources of division in the culture wars in some Western countries and societies".

He added, "We should not import these culture wars into Singapore, or allow issues of gender identity to divide our society."

Schools can exercise flexibility if there are valid medical grounds and work out practical arrangements for transgender students who may face difficulty with certain rules.

Answering a question from Warren Fernandez, editor-in-chief of The Straits Times, Minister for Education and Co-chair of the Multi Ministry Taskforce (MTF) Lawrence Wong reflects on decision making during Covid-19 and his experiences from the past year.

At a press conference on Jan. 22, Minister Lawrence Wong provided clarifications on the "maximum of 8 visitors per household per day" rule, and addressed the media's questions on how it will be enforced.
We hit the streets to find out what people think about the use of TraceTogether data for criminal investigations.

‚ÄúVery happy to be working with him‚Äù. ‚Ä®

Gan Kim Yong and Lawrence Wong took a moment to show appreciation to one another. Awwwww.

MTF co-chair Lawrence Wong said: ‚ÄúSo for those who chose not to take up, it‚Äôs your choice, but we will roll out and push out the vaccines regardless. And if you want to wait, you must accept the consequence that perhaps if you wait later, if the vaccine supply has been taken up, you may- and you want to take it up later on, you may not have the ready supply.‚Äù

Trace(criminals)Together? üö®üèÉüö®

In this week‚Äôs podcast episode, we speak to a lawyer to find out what the CPC (Criminal Procedure Code) is, and how concerned you should be about your data being used.

Click the #linkinbio to listen to the full episode.

Let‚Äôs say there is a murder, and [the] victim, victim‚Äôs family...and information is available on the TraceTogether tokens. If [the] police chose not to seek that information, you can imagine how the victim‚Äôs family, and indeed the rest of Singapore, might react to that situation.‚Äù

Home affairs minister K Shanmugam also added that the Police will restrict use of TraceTogether data to "very serious offences"

"Once Covid-19 pandemic is over, and there is no longer a need for contact tracing, we will most happily and cheerfully stand the [TraceTogether] programme down."

At a Parliament session on Jan. 5 2021, Minister Vivian Balakrishnan addressed questions on privacy concerns regarding the use of TraceTogether in criminal investigations. He added that he had not thought of the application of the Criminal Procedure Code (CPC) to TraceTogether data in an earlier statement about the matter.

In response to NCMP Leong Mun Wai's question on how Singapore can reopen its borders to foreigners, Minister Lawrence Wong said that every time a measure is relaxed, there is increased risk and "all of the risks do add up".

He added that one factor which would let Singapore open up more would be vaccinations, but expects that a "significant number of people" would be vaccinated only by the third quarter of the year.

It was a different first day of school for 3,500 Kindergarten 1 students and 40,000 Primary 1 students in Singapore.

Minister for Education Lawrence Wong visited Waterway Primary School on the morning of Jan. 4 to observe the implementation of safe management measures and to greet students and their parents.

According to the Criminal Procedure Code, a death sentence must not be passed or recorded against someone below the age of 18 years old.

Life imprisonment, on the other hand, is allowed. #linkinbio 

Photo from Google Maps.

The total number of cases in Singapore is now 58,124. #linkinbio

Photo from Lawrence Wong/FB.

Time to flex your tokens. #linkinbio 

Photos by Guan Zhen Tan.

Patrons will not be allowed to enter the cinemas if they do not have TraceTogether token or its app. #linkinbio 

Photos via Gov Tech & Google Maps.
Speaking at a press conference, Multi-ministry taskforce Co-chairperson Lawrence Wong said: "We really need to have a good part of workers travelling in the off-peak hours after 9.30am."

SMS alerts will now also be sent to a smaller group of individuals who were at locations assessed to pose a higher risk of transmission at the same time as Covid-19 cases.

However, the government previously said that people do not need to avoid venues visited by confirmed cases. Minister-in-charge of the Smart Nation Initiative Vivian Balakrishnan also emphasised that the government will still notify those at risk and advise on the precautions to take.

The token is available for free for all residents in Singapore, and every resident in Singapore is encouraged to either download the TraceTogether app or to collect a TraceTogether Token. These updates were announced by Minister-in-charge of the Smart Nation Initiative Vivian Balakrishnan in a virtual press conference by the the Multi-Ministry Taskforce (MTF) on Wednesday (Sep. 9).

This round of distribution will begin in the Jalan Besar and Tanjong Pagar regions, where there is a higher concentration of elderly individuals, and the nextended throughout Singapore progressively.

Speaking to the press on Sept. 9, Minister Lawrence Wong said that to date, there are still people flouting safe distancing measures, especially when they dine out.

"I would say our ability to continue on this path of progressive resumption of activities rests largely on two factors‚Äî one, we have to control the infection and keep numbers down... But secondly, it also depends on our ability to comply with existing measures."

"It's also not fair for the majority of operators who are complying with the rules, and yet these few are taking their chances and breaching the rules. So our enforcement agencies will be stepping up spot checks, as well as enforcement actions."

The government is also trialing the deployment of SafeEntry at certain places which require the TraceTogether app or token to check in. #linkinbio

Photos via GovTech.

From Aug. 29, Lucky Plaza and Peninsula Plaza will implement odd and even date entry restrictions on weekends, based on the last digit of an individual‚Äôs National Registration Identification Card (NRIC) or Foreign Identification Number (FIN).

Large crowds and long queues to enter the two malls every weekend have made crowd management and safe distancing a challenge for mall managers.

Other premises that face similar crowd management issues may also be required to adopt these entry restrictions.

Did you know that elephants are keystone species? Keystone species are species whose survival is critical to the survival of others in the ecosystem. In this case, elephant poop has a pretty important role in it.

Have an up-close and personal experience with these majestic beasts from the comfort of your own home.

Note: Some footage in the video shows an earlier elephant presentation format that has been revamped by Singapore Zoo from 2018. According to Singapore Zoo, this is done in line with animal welfare guidelines and best practices for safety, where animals and keepers are not placed in a shared space. Activities which the elephants are involved in now are voluntary and enrichment-based.

At a press conference on Aug. 6, Minister Lawrence Wong announced that testing at dormitories would be completed by Aug. 7, with the exception of several standalone blocks which serve as quarantine facilities.

He highlighted that workers who are currently in isolation would need to be tested before leaving quarantine facilities, and that it's possible "volatile case numbers" may come from this group over the next two weeks.

Minister for Foreign Affairs, Vivian Balakrishnan spoke to the media at a doorstop on Jul. 26 regarding the implementation of Reciprocal Green Lane (RGL) and Periodic Commuting Arrangement (PCA). 

These 2 schemes are implemented to facilitate cross-border travel for essential business and official purposes. The application will be opened on Aug. 10, 2020.
In response to the media on the implications of the reshuffle on leadership renewal, Vivian Balakrishnan said that the 4G leaders are in "complete unity" behind DPM Heng's leadership.

Lawrence Wong has been given a new appointment as Minister for Education.

Although this wasn't exactly a promotion, as Wong was a full Cabinet Minister already, it does represent something of a step up.

Two of the cases are outside of dormitories, both of which are Work Pass holders.

‚ÄúWe are also putting in place enhanced control measures at these popular places, for example monitoring the people who are entering the beaches, or the parks and when it comes close to capacity limits we will proactively stop people from going in.‚Äù - Minister Lawrence Wong, at a press conference on Jul. 24.
"They have worked very hard, and we are finally reaching the last stretch." - Minister Lawrence Wong, at a press conference on Jul. 24.

At a press conference on July 17, Minister Lawrence Wong highlighted the new SHN requirements for travellers from Victoria state in Australia, Japan and Hong Kong. This new development is due to the resurgence of cases in various locations.

The change will commence after Jul. 19, 2359.

"So I think let's not jump to the conclusion just because we see queues forming, queues form everywhere and not just when people go and cast the vote, queues form in FNB outlets, queues form in hawker centers and markets, so there are queues everywhere."

At a press conference on July 17, Minister Lawrence Wong addressed the possibility of new clusters happening after GE2020. He pointed out the safety procedures ELD has taken and mentioned that queueing does not necessarily "cause the transmission of the virus". He also emphasised the need for individuals to take "responsibility for our own behaviors".

"There were these scenes of people coming together to celebrate. Ideally, they would have practised safe distancing. The people who were there - they know who they are, but I think the moment got the better of them and they perhaps forgot about some of these requirements.

But from the pictures I've seen, all of them were wearing masks. They may not have kept to the rule of 5, and if we can find out who they are, and we have a means to, we might be able to identify and take them to task.

Unfortunately, this appears to have happened in that particular incident, and I would imagine it will not be the end of it. There will be many other incidents where lapses do occur."

Minister Lawrence Wong was responding to a question on whether Singapore should expect a pickup in the number of Covid-19 infections due to the queues and crowds gathering during GE2020.

Minister Lawrence Wong said in a press conference on Jul. 17 that Singapore's travel advisory position is unlikely to change in the near term.

It's okay, can save money.

During a Coffee Talk session with PAP's Holland-Bukit Timah GRC and Bukit Panjang SMC candidates on Jul. 8, Minister Vivian Balakrishnan got emotional when recalling how his late mum scrimped and saved for rainy days.

20/20/20 is a video series where we have politicians answer 20 questions by 20 people in their 20s.

We got Vivian Balakrishnan, Minister for Foreign Affairs, to answer questions from youths on what regional neighbours will be watching for as they observe our GE, the possibility of voting online and how he ended up taking that selfie with Kim Jong Un.

58 households in Block 111 Tampines Street 11 will be placed under active phone surveillance over the next couple of weeks. More aggressive contact tracing will be extended to the entire block if deemed necessary.

Now you can remember what the sea and sweaty strangers smell like.

Starting Friday, Jun.19, many public facilities will be open again, such as swimming complexes, playgrounds and sports halls. Also reopening are aesthetic services such as beauty salons, gyms and private enrichment classes. However, there will be some restrictions regarding social distancing -- for example, at any one time, even while exiting the premises, there must not be more than a group of 5 people.
They were tested as part of the proactive surveillance of persons who work at dormitories.

#linkinbio 
Video from Privacy Ninja / FB

National Development Minister Lawrence Wong delivered a national broadcast earlier today on living amidst Covid-19 in Singapore. 
This is the second in a series of national broadcasts that will be delivered by multiple ministers from Jun. 7 to Jun 20, 2020.

According to Minister-in-charge of the Smart Nation initiative Vivian Balakrishnan, there's no electronic tagging or geolocation tracking in the TraceTogether token. ‚ÄúThe first batch will probably be delivered in half of this month. So we will roll that out progressively at that point‚Äù

According to Minister Gan Kim Yong, the risk of population-wide testing is that infected individuals, still in the incubation period would remain undetected and could go on to infect others. However, a targeted testing strategy ‚Å†‚Äî employing serological testing and contact tracing ‚Å†‚Äî would be able to identify even asymptomatic individuals.

According to Minister Lawrence Wong, Phase 2 may happen before the end of June, if community infection rates remain low and stable.

Phase 2 would see the resumption of a range of activities, including retail services, dining in at F&B outlets, reopening of sports facilities and family visits, subject to a group size cap of 5 people.

At a press conference on May 28, Minister Lawrence Wong said that allowing essential travel will resume businesses, and jobs will "continue". However, mass market travel will have to wait "a bit longer". New measures being established include "travel bubbles" to countries deemed safe, and possibly conducting PCR testing for incoming travellers.

"If people choose to disregard the rules, they choose to continue to flout, breach the rules, and you know, take reckless actions that may cause clusters to form, then it will be very very hard for us to proceed on these timelines" - Minister Lawrence Wong

In other words, don't be a CB if you don't want CB.

For the past 5 days, Singapore has had only single-digit community cases. At a press conference on 15 May, Minister Gan Kim Yong attributed the low count to circuit breaker measures, but also said an increase in cases was likely as more people go back to work. 
He added that there will be a focus on quarantine and contact tracing efforts to reduce the risk of large clusters forming again.

But Lawrence Wong cautioned that as more activities resume, the country has be "very careful" to prevent the number of new cases from spiking, and to prevent large clusters from forming again.

This is why the country will need to go about the resumption of activities in a cautious and "step by step" approach, he said. #linkinbio

Photo from Andrew Koay.

Minister Lawrence Wong: "Please don't rush to the barber today. You have plenty of time. My hair was cut by my wife at home." From May 12, barbers and hairdressers will be allowed to reopen to provide basic haircut services.

In a press conference on May 12, Director of Medical Services Kenneth Mak said that this diversification is to help ensure that Singapore has sufficient capacity for testing now, and in the future. 
In the same press conference, Minister Lawrence Wong mentioned that more than 32,000 workers in dormitories have been tested, which is about 10% of the total number of workers in the dormitories to be tested.

It was announced previously that around 8,000 tests are now conducted daily.
Speaking at a press conference today (May 8), Minister Lawrence Wong reminded people to "pace ourselves" and to not rush to go out because of the ease of restrictions from May 12. #DontRushChallenge

In a press conference on May 2, Minister Lawrence Wong shared that from May 12, selected services including home-based business will be allowed to resume operations. For the full list of services: https://bit.ly/2xr81c9

This is part of a slew of CB measures that will be lifted in the coming weeks.

In response to a question from the media, Minister Lawrence Wong elaborated that these new dormitories can be built quickly, may not be permanent, and would allow for new, long-term, permanent dormitories to be built in the meantime.

Speaking at a press conference today (May 1), Minister Lawrence Wong urged everyone to remain vigilant and that it would be "premature for anyone, whether in Singapore, or anywhere in the world to assume that once we pass this particular wave, and say, in June, July, the world will be free from Covid-19 and life would be able to resume. No one can say that."

In response to a question about whether food given to foreign workers will improve, Minister Lawrence Wong mentioned that while there are photos circulating, food caterers are constantly making adjustments based feedback provided by foreign workers.

According to Minister Lawrence Wong, increased testing of Covid-19 is a "key enabler" to relax measures in a safe manner. He also mentioned that it is one part of a 'holistic strategy' to overcome the virus, in addition to good personal hygiene and safe distancing measures. Keep washing your hands, people.

[JUST IN] 15 Singaporeans and PRs are among the new cases reported today, while the vast majority of the cases remain Work Permit holders residing in foreign worker dormitories.

Almost three months after the first Covid-19 case was announced on Jan. 23, the number of cases in Singapore has crossed the 10,000 mark.

Does TraceTogether track my location? Is my data safe? Will Big Brother be watching me? How does it even work? Does it replace contact tracing?

We asked one of the people who created the app for the answers.

In a press conference on March 31, Minister Lawrence Wong urged all Singaporeans to stay at home whenever possible to minimise the spread of the virus.

He also mentioned that Singapore has an excellent contact tracing team, and that they are going all out -- however, it will be "very difficult for them as they go about doing their work that we see new cases popping up every day".

In a press conference on Mar. 31, Lawrence Wong mentioned that due to telecommuting, the volume during peak hours on public transport has decreased by about 30%. .
.
30% less traffic during peak hour due to telecommuting = social distancing on public transport.

On keeping schools open, PM Lee said today (Mar. 27) that closing schools does not solve any problems. 
He also stated that if teachers are unable to socialise and guide children, and if parents are unable to make for the lack of enrichment at home, children will be put at a disadvantage.
Lawrence Wong was overcome with emotion while delivering a ministerial statement in Parliament, thanking S‚Äôporeans who go all out to fight #Covid19 today (Mar. 25, 2020).

[BREAKING] All bars and entertainment venues like night clubs, discos, cinemas, theatres, and karaoke outlets, where there is a high risk of transmission due to sustained close contact over a period of time, will be closed. 
Apart from entertainment venues, all centre-based tuition and enrichment classes will be suspended to reduce the intermingling of students from different schools.

Organised tours in public venues (such as sightseeing or guided walking tours) will also be suspended.

Photo from Zouk SG

While new social distancing measures were announced this week, crowds have still been observed at restaurants and nightlife hotspots around Singapore.

Lawrence Wong said on Mar. 22 that "We do need Singaporeans to understand that they themselves, every individual needs to exercise responsibility in this area."

Called TraceTogether, the mobile app enables community-driven contact tracing through short-distance Bluetooth signals between mobile phones that have the app installed.

The app estimates the distance between users, as well as the duration of their encounters to identify those who were in close contact with a confirmed Covid-19 case.

The records of these encounters are encrypted and stored locally on each user‚Äôs phone for 21 days, which covers the incubation period of the coronavirus.

Photo by Syahindah Ishak

From March 18 to March 31, Malaysia‚Äôs newly announced emergency lockdown measures will be in place.

This new announcement was made by National Development Minister Lawrence Wong on Friday (Mar. 13) morning, at the Multi-Ministry Taskforce for Covid-19‚Äôs latest press conference.

He also announced new travel advisories for Singaporeans planning trips to Italy, France, Germany and Spain, urging all to defer or avoid non-essential travel to these countries.

"I have to drop everything, go down, talk to the [patient], get all the information, and then submit it, everything, in 2 hours." Contact tracing is an important step in detecting positive Covid-19 cases, and the people who do it have been working round the clock to ensure the job is done.

Here's what a contact tracer at Singapore General Hospital does.

The couple had given false information to MOH officials about their movements and whereabouts from Jan. 22 to Jan. 29 when they were contacted for contact tracing.

If convicted, they can be fined up to S$10,000 or jailed for a maximum of six months, or both.

Image from Kenny Chua/Google Maps.

Travellers from Cheongdo & Daegu barred from entering S'pore from Feb. 27.

Travel restrictions have yet to be placed on Italy, but it is "on our radar screen," Minister for National Development Lawrence Wong added.

This helps with contact tracing, but why is tracing recovered patients important?

The problem with contact tracing is that the trail can be lost when one is unable to make connections to previous cases.

This could happen if the tests are unable to detect the presence of Covid-19 in a spreader who has recovered. .

If Singapore is not able to determine the source, infections and clusters would be harder to contain.

As of Feb. 16, there are twelve confirmed Covid-19 patients linked to the Mei Hwan Drive cluster, with at least nine of them having attended the same same Chinese New Year gathering.

Contact tracing revealed that the source of the virus at the gathering is a married couple, who were likely exposed to the virus at The Life Church and Missions Singapore.

Photo from Unsplash

Despite effective contact tracing, it was previously unknown how the Grace Assembly of God (GAOG) churches came to become the largest cluster of Covid-19 cases in Singapore.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
CID's investigations reveal that the virus likely originated with Case 8 and 9. They are Chinese nationals from Wuhan who had also been to Life Church and Missions on Jan. 19.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
They infected six other people at the church, two of which headed for a Chinese New year gathering at Mei Hwan Drive on Jan. 25.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Seven more people, including a staff member with GAOG, were subsequently infected after this gathering.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Image from GAOG.

Speaking at a press conference on Feb. 14, Minister Gan said: ‚ÄúEpidemiological studies and contact tracing still continues with respect to the cluster involving members of Grace Assembly of God church. At this time we do not have enough information to identify a clear individual as being a super spreader or to suspect that this is indeed the case.‚Äù Photo from Google Streetview.

Community spread has now been confirmed by the Singapore government.

Contact tracing for case 29 has not established a link to any previous cases or travel history to mainland China.

All three new cases confirmed today, as of this article, do not have any links to previous ones, but contact tracing is underway.

Photo screenshot from Mothership video

Contact tracing is underway and the source of infection for these three cases has not been identified.

In a question and answer after a technical briefing on Jan. 30, Lawrence Wong, co-chair of the Wuhan virus task force, revealed that some Singaporeans could not be brought back to Singapore because they already showed symptoms of the Wuhan virus.
